text.p: British food and agribusiness group Dalgety Plc on Monday said hikes in raw material costs and the mad cow disease crisis were to blame for a 20 percent drop in profits last year.

Pre-tax profits in the year to June 30 excluding exceptional items fell to 101.9 million pounds ($158.5 million) from 127.1 million. Profits including exceptional items were 89.6 million pounds, down from 93.7 million.
Sales fell to 4.34 billion pounds from 4.91 billion. Dalgety held its dividend for the year unchanged at 22 pence.
Chief executive Richard Clothier said the past year had been exceptionally challenging for the group.
"A steep rise in raw material costs and the BSE crisis seriously affected four of our five businesses," he said in a statement.
He said the group's petfood business in Britain performed less well than expected due to lower sales volumes. ($1=.6430 Pound)
